meanings.definition: The quality of being particularly noticeable or important.
meanings.sent1: The salience of the bright red sign caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The salience of the issue made it a topic of discussion among all.
meanings.sent3: The salience of the clown's nose made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The salience of her voice in the quiet room was like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The salience of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being prominent or conspicuous.
meanings.sent1: The salience of the tall tower made it visible from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The salience of her hat in the crowd made her easy to spot.
meanings.sent3: The salience of the cat in the dog park caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The salience of the full moon in the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The salience of the neon sign in the dark alley was striking.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something stands out or is easily perceived.
meanings.sent1: The salience of the smell of fresh bread drew customers into the bakery.
meanings.sent2: The salience of the typo in the document was hard to miss.
meanings.sent3: The salience of the penguin in the desert puzzled the explorers.
meanings.sent4: The salience of her kindness in a world of indifference was like a light.
meanings.sent5: The salience of the shooting star in the night sky was unforgettable.
